europeana:record.dc:title: Taxonomic notes on the entedonine genera Rhynchentedon and Pediobomyia (Hymenoptera, Chalcidoidea: Eulophidae) with the description of a new species
Zoologische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gumovsky A.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Insecta
Eulophidae
Entedoninae
Pediobius
Horismenus

Oriental
Australasian
distribution
europeana:record.dc:description: The genera Rhynchentedon and Pediobomyia are reviewed, redescribed and their placement within so-called Pediobius-complex of genera is discussed. A new species (Rhynchentedon achterbergi spec. nov.) is described from Malaysia. The new species is characterized by the specific shape of petiole (with protruding dorsal callus). The number of setae at the submarginal vein is found to be variable in Pediobomyia darwini Girault. New geographical records are reported for both Rhynchentedon and Pediobomyia.
